column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=[0061] Preparation of CH.sub.2.dbd.CHC(O)--O--CH(CF.sub.3)(CF(CF.sub.3).su-b.2) Homopolymer

#Text=[0062] Perfluoro(methyl isopropyl ketone) (64 g, 0.24 mol, can be prepared as described in Example 5 of World Published Application WO 01/05468) was reduced to the corresponding alcohol with NaBH.sub.4 (10.9 g, 0.29 mol, available from Sigma-Aldrich Chemical Co., Milwaukee, Wis.) in 235 mL anhydrous diglyme (anhydrous diethylene glycol dimethyl ether, available from Sigma-Aldrich Chemical Co.) at approximately 0.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=The reaction mixture was quenched with cold 10% aqueous HCI (200 miL).
#Text=The lower phase was isolated, washed twice with 200 mL aliquots of saturated NaCl solution at 0.degree.
#Text=C., dried over anhydrous MgSO.sub.4 and filtered to give a filtrate (80.7 g).
#Text=The solvent was distilled from the filtrate to produce 56.7 g of 1,1,1,3,4,4,4-heptafluoro-3-(trifluoromethy-l)-2-butanol with a yield of 88% (b.p.=100-140.degree.
#Text=C.).
#Text=Analysis by proton and fluorine NMR showed the following peaks: -72.5(3F), -75.5(3F), -74.3(3F), -182.7(1F), 4.6 (1H), 3.8 (1H).
#Text=[0063] 25.7 g (0.096 mol) of the 1,1,1,3,4,4,4-heptafluoro-3-(trifluoromet-hyl)-2-butanol was dissolved in diglyme (50 ml) and the resulting solution was cooled to 5.degree.
#Text=C. under a nitrogen blanket.
#Text=Acryloyl chloride (9.5 g, 0.105 mol, available from Sigma-Aldrich Chemical Company) was added to this solution by syringe while stirring.
#Text=To this solution was added diisopropylethyl amine (13.6 g, 0.105 mol, available from Sigma-Aldrich Chemical Co.) dropwise over a period of 35 minutes.
#Text=After 2 hours, the reaction mixture was filtered to remove the solid by-products and the filtrate was diluted with methylene chloride (40 mL).

#Text=The filtrate was then washed three times with 75 ML aliquots of saturated NaCl solution, dried over anhydrous MgSO.sub.4, filtered, and the solvent removed by rotary evaporation to leave a residue of 22 g of crude acrylate ester.
#Text=The acrylate ester was purified via column chromatography using silica gel to produce 16.2 g of purified ester.
#Text=Fluorine NMR analysis showed the following peaks: -74.3 (3F), -75.5(3F), -182.7(1F), -72.4(3F).
#Text=Proton NMR analysis showed the following peaks: 6.15 (1H), and 3 olefinic hydrogens at 6.6, 6.2, and 6.1 ppm.
#Text=[0064] The purified acrylate ester (5.5 g, 0.017 mol) and VAZO.TM. 64 initiator (28 mg) was then dissolved in 30 g of ethyl acetate in a 4 oz (110 g) polymerization bottle.
#Text=The solution was purged for 90 seconds using N.sub.2 at 1 L/min, then polymerization was affected by heating the solution for 26 hours by rotating the bottle in a heated water bath.
#Text=After the polymerization, the solvent was removed by rotary evaporation.
#Text=The resulting yellow oil was twice dissolved in acetone and precipitated from solution with chloroform.
#Text=The resulting solid was collected by filtration and dried.
#Text=The structure of the homopolymer was verified by proton and fluorine NMR.
#Text=Tg was 53.9.degree.
#Text=C. with onset at 27.7.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=The solid collected by filtration was dissolved at 3% solids in C.sub.4F.sub.9OCH.sub.3 (available as HFE-7100 Engineering Fluid from 3M Company, St.
#Text=Paul, Minn.).
#Text=[0065] Polymer 2.
